result.execSummary:
The defendant Lindsey J. Golomski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $50 month payment plan to commence on or before June 25, 2015
If after 12 months the defendant has paid the fine & costs in full and has had no criminal violations, the defendant may petition the Court for expungement under 973.015

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lindsey J. Golomski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Lindsey J. Golomski
Current: 615 South Market St. #8, Westfield, WI 53964 United States  (Effective: 08-24-2015)
Prior: 615 S. Market St., #8, Westfield, WI 53964

Defendant Lindsey J. Galomski in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the criminal complaint has the defendant's last name incorrect; it should be Golomski.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court orders the name to be changed to the correct spelling of Golomski.

  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Atty Hendee asks that booking needs to be completed only as the case is resolved today.
Atty Gumz has no objection.
BY THE COURT:  Court orders that the defendant appear for booking today.

  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Hendee has no objection to expungment with conditions.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Gumz makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Pay fine and costs = $379.00
DNA Surcharge = $200.00
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in June
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
  If after 12 months the defendant has paid the fine and costs in full and has had no criminal violations, the defendant may petition the court for Expungement 973.015.
  **Appear for booking today
Court advises defendant of DNA Sample requirement per statute.
